basics.name: Kelly Hwang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science, Data Science Track in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawai'i at Mānoa. I expect to graduate in Spring 2023.

education.institution: University of Hawai'i at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Computer Science, Data Science Track (expected Spring, 2023)

education.institution: University of Hawai'i at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

work.company: Water Resources Research Center at University of Hawai’i at Mānoa
highlights: Providing computer science and information technology support across various research opportunities and data portals
Applying data science algorithms to work with data and applying prepackaged software stacks to relevant project tasks
Technologies used: Linux environment, Ansible, Docker, DKAN, SQL, Node

work.company: Ames Research Center, National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
highlights: Analyzed and processed data for unsteady pressure sensitive paint (uPSP) project by cross-correlating kulite microphone and uPSP data for a new wind tunnel pressure measurement system, and additional statistical research
Produced multiple PSDs using Python scripts to show cross-correlation, time lag, and decay at sampled frequencies
Technologies used: Python, Linux environment, data visualization, script automation

work.company: Board of Student Activities at Kapi’olani Community College
highlights: Collaborated within a diverse college student-run chartered student organization, significantly contributed to the group’s organization via budget strategies, administrative functions, and all key functions of student activities management

Launched multiple campus-wide events, hosted a variety of online events, created various posters and videos, executed Instagram and Youtube video campaigns in collaboration with campus departments, all with COVID-19 restrictions
Utilized local hospitality network to bolster engagement and drive business by organizing public and private events

Founded and nurtured a platform of Hong Kong expatriates by curating relevant content to assist with the organic audience growth on social media, namely Facebook and Instagram, leading to a 10x growth in engagement and followers
Member, Virtual NASA Community College Aerospace Scholars (VNCAS): A NASA Experience, 2021-2021

awards.title: Indigenous Knowledge in Engineering, Pre-Engineering Education Collaborative II
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to community college STEM minorities students interested in engineering.
